title: In which universities US I can study for completely free, if I’m not EU citizen but have good score in SAT, ACT etc. and good high school grades in my country and also already entered to an university in my country? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in the United States of America

response.answer_text: Look on the university webpages for international admissions and financial aid. Many universities, especially private ones, will offer the chance of winning a merit scholarship--so it is possible that you could study for free. That said, in my experience, international undergrads often overestimate their chances for admission. So apply to schools that you think you have a good chance to get into, and some schools that have MUCH lower standards for admissions than you possess. You probably won't get a scholarship at a school that you just make it into.
None. Universities are not free except in some exceptional cases for a legal resident of a particular State - which excludes you. Total false expectation!
